studyDesigns.name: Study Design
studyDesigns.rationale: Protocol-defined study design for investigating efficacy and safety

arms.name: ALXN1840 Treatment
arms.description: All participants receive ALXN1840, starting at 15 mg/day for approximately 28 days, followed by titration up to 30 mg/day on Day 29.

studyCohorts.name: Cohort 1 (treatment experienced)
studyCohorts.characteristic: Patients who have received WD therapy for > 28 days

studyCohorts.name: Cohort 2 (treatment naïve)
studyCohorts.characteristic: Patients who have received WD therapy for ≤ 28 days

population.name: Study Population
population.description: Target population for the study as defined by eligibility criteria

objectives.text: Assess net copper balance with daily repeat-dose ALXN1840 treatment (15 mg and 30 mg) in participants with Wilson disease (WD)
Assess change in copper balance in response to ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day during ALXN1840 accumulation and at steady state periods versus the pretreatment baseline in participants with WD
Investigate the effect of ALXN1840 (15 mg/day and 30 mg/day) on the disposition of copper in participants with WD
Investigate the effect of ALXN1840 on the disposition of molybdenum at steady state at 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD
Assess steady-state total molybdenum balance as a measure of ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD
Assess accumulation of molybdenum with ALXN1840 treatment at 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD
Determine the steady-state plasma pharmacokinetic (PK) of total molybdenum and plasma ultrafiltrate (PUF) molybdenum (as surrogate measures of ALXN1840, 15 mg and 30 mg) in participants with WD
Evaluate the safety and tolerability of repeated-dose administration of ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD
Determine dose response of ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day for copper balance in participants with WD
Determine the effect of treatment duration on copper balance in participants with WD
Assess the effects of ALXN1840 on ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound copper LBC profiles in plasma in participants with WD

endpoints.text: Mean daily copper balance where copper balance is measured by the calculated difference between copper intake (in food and drink) and copper output (in feces and urine) during ALXN1840 accumulation and steady-state periods for each dose

Change in mean daily copper balance as measured by the calculated difference between copper intake (in food and drink) and copper output (in feces and urine) from pretreatment baseline (Days -4 through -1) and ALXN1840 accumulation and steady-state periods for each dose
Copper quantified in food, drink, feces, and urine, including plasma total and labile bound copper (LBC) during ALXN1840 accumulation and steady-state periods for each dose
Molybdenum quantified in food, drink, feces, and urine, plasma total molybdenum at ALXN1840 steady state
Mean daily molybdenum balance as demonstrated through measurement of molybdenum intake (in food, drink and ALXN1840), and molybdenum output (feces and urine) representing ALXN1840 steady state
Accumulation of molybdenum as determined by molybdenum balance
PK parameters for plasma total and PUF-molybdenum
Treatment emergent adverse events (TEAEs)/serious adverse events (SAEs)
Clinical laboratory assessments (serum chemistry, hematology, coagulation, and urinalysis)
Heart rate, intervals (PR, QRS, QT and QTc), and clinically significant electrocardiogram (ECG) findings as determined by triplicate 12-lead ECG
Vital sign assessments (blood pressure and heart rate)
Assess dose response of ALXN1840 on copper balance focusing on copper balance
Determine the effect of time following initiation of ALXN1840 treatment on copper balance
Ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound copper, and LBC: Change in ceruloplasmin at Days 1, 8, 25, 29, 36, and Day 39 compared with predose

studyInterventions.name: ALXN1840
studyInterventions.description: A novel copper binding agent in development for the treatment of Wilson disease (WD).

studyInterventions.name: Paracetamol/acetaminophen
studyInterventions.description: Permitted for use as an exception with the approval of the Investigator.

studyInterventions.name: Ibuprofen
studyInterventions.description: Permitted for use with caution and approval of the Investigator.

activities.name: HIV, hepatitis B and C screen
activities.description: HIV, hepatitis B and C screen

activities.name: Blood sampling for PK: Plasma total Mo and PUF-Mo
activities.description: Blood sampling for PK: Plasma total Mo and PUF-Mo

activities.name: PD: Plasma total and PUF-Cu, LBC, ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound Cu
activities.description: PD: Plasma total and PUF-Cu, LBC, ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound Cu

activities.name: Urination and bowel movement monitoring, menstruation checks
activities.description: Urination and bowel movement monitoring, menstruation checks

notes.text: a. Within 42 days of ALXN1840 administration. Details of procedures that may be performed by sites designated as “screening sites” (only in the US) are detailed in Section 8.
b. Participants will be admitted to the clinical research unit (CRU) at least 10 hours prior to enrollment and initiation of copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet.
c. At the CRU’s discretion, participants may remain in the CRU or be readmitted on Day 22 with all procedures starting on Day 23.
d. Unscheduled study visits may occur at any time during the study and may include any study procedure as deemed necessary by the Investigator.
e. Participants are required to return to the CRU Day 54+/-2; participants will be discontinued from ALXN1840 medication by their physician at the latest by the Day 54 follow-up.

f. Discharge from the unit may occur after completion of all procedures on Day 9 and on Day 40 and after the Investigator has reviewed all safety assessment (including safety laboratory tests) and confirmed that the participant is appropriate for discharge.

g. A single outpatient visit or phone call and safety laboratory assessment should occur between Day 14 and Day 18. A phone call may take place on a different day than the blood draw within the Day 14 through Day 18 period.
h. If needed to confirm menopause.
i. Parameters include age and sex. Race and ethnicity will be collected where permitted by local regulations.
j. Wilson disease history will include diagnosis date, method of diagnosis, history of cirrhosis, details of any previous liver biopsies performed, and treatment received.

k. A full physical examination will be performed at Screening, at check-in for the study, and at the End of the study/Early Termination Visit. A physical examination should also be performed on any participants with ongoing adverse events prior to discharge from the unit. Otherwise, a symptom-driven physical examination may be performed at other times, at the Principal Investigator’s discretion.
l. Height at screening only.

m. While in the CRU, study intervention will be administered after an overnight fast (ie, at least 10 hours) at the same time every morning; drug is to be administered with 240 mL of water and meals should be delayed a minimum of 2 hours after dosing. As an outpatient, participants are expected to take ALXN1840 at approximately the same time daily (+/- 1 hour). Participants should take the medication with a glass of water on an empty stomach; meals should be delayed a minimum of 2 hours after dosing.
n. During the outpatient period, participants will use SMS text messaging to confirm study intervention administration.
o. Blood sampling for PK/PD will occur before ALXN1840 administration and represents a predose trough. See Table 2 for PK/PD sampling on Days 1, 25, 29, and 39.
p. PK/PD collection will include timepoints described in the schedule of PK/PD assessment for Days 1, 25, 29, and 39 (Table 2).

q. Samples for serum chemistry will be obtained following a fast of at least 8 hours at the Screening Visit and at check-in. In case of rechecks, and postdose serum chemistry, participants may not have fasted for 6 or 8 hours before the serum chemistry sample is taken.
r. Laboratory assessment including chemistry, hematology, and coagulation parameters should be performed on Days -8, -1, 8, 23, and 28 only.

s. Menstruation check is for women only; women of childbearing potential should only be enrolled after a negative serum pregnancy test result at Screening. Additional urine pregnancy testing will be started for the protocol unless serum testing is required by site policies, local regulation, or Institutional Review Boards (IRBs)/Independent Ethics Committees (IECs) (Section 10.2). In addition to pregnancy tests detailed at the visits in the SoA, females of childbearing potential will be required to perform urine pregnancy tests at least every 4 weeks at their home or the study site throughout their time in the study.
t. A single 15 mL serum sample will be retained for evaluation in the event of an unexpected safety finding; retained samples may be destroyed after completion of the clinical study report.

u. Vital signs assessments and ECGs should be performed predose, unless otherwise specified. Vitals signs include body temperature, heart rate, respiratory rate, and systolic and diastolic blood pressure.

v. Copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet will be initiated after registration/inclusion. Participants will remain on a copper/molybdenum controlled diet throughout both the inpatient Period 1 (Day -8 to Day 9) and inpatient Period 2 (Day 23 to Day 40); during this time participants will be strongly encouraged to complete all meals. While not in the CRU, participants will be encouraged to adhere to their usual copper-controlled diet.
w. For each input/output balance period, 24-hour urine samples are to be collected for measurement of copper and molybdenum.
x. For fecal samples, each individual sample will be independently collected with record of date, time, and weight of the sample.

studyAmendments.summary: The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to update procedures outlined in the Schedule of Activities, remove contradictory text on the reporting of serious adverse events, and add details of an interim analysis.

The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to revise the exclusion criterion for a urine drug screen. Changes implemented via Administrative Letter 1 and Administrative Letter 2, as well as COVID vaccination guidance, have also been incorporated.
The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to update the washout period for zinc.

The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to clarify study procedures occurring across different sites in the US, so as to facilitate participant recruitment across different regions of the US, and to lessen inconvenience for participants without compromising the quality of the study.

procedures.name: Blood Sampling
procedures.label: Blood Draw
procedures.description: Collection of blood samples for pharmacokinetic (PK), pharmacodynamic (PD), and clinical laboratory assessments (serum chemistry, hematology, coagulation).

code.decode: Collection of venous blood by venipuncture

procedures.name: 24-hour Urine Collection
procedures.label: Urine Collection
procedures.description: Collection of 24-hour pooled urine samples for measurement of copper and molybdenum content.

procedures.name: Fecal Collection
procedures.label: Fecal Sample Collection
procedures.description: Collection of individual fecal samples for measurement of copper and molybdenum content.

procedures.name: Physical Examination
procedures.label: Physical Exam
procedures.description: Complete physical examination including assessments of the cardiovascular, respiratory, gastrointestinal, and neurological systems.

procedures.name: Vital Signs Measurement
procedures.label: Vital Signs
procedures.description: Assessment of body temperature, heart rate, respiratory rate, and systolic and diastolic blood pressure.

procedures.name: 12-lead Electrocardiogram
procedures.label: 12-lead ECG
procedures.description: Triplicate 12-lead ECG to assess heart rate and intervals (PR, QRS, QT and QTc).

code.decode: Electrocardiogram, routine ECG with at least 12 leads; with interpretation and report

procedures.label: Clinical Safety Labs
procedures.description: Laboratory assessments including serum chemistry, hematology, and coagulation panels.

procedures.name: Urinalysis
procedures.label: Urinalysis
procedures.description: Analysis of urine for diagnostic purposes.

procedures.name: Pregnancy Test
procedures.label: Pregnancy Test
procedures.description: Urine and/or serum pregnancy testing for females of childbearing potential.

procedures.name: Oral Administration of Study Intervention
procedures.label: Oral Dosing
procedures.description: Participant to swallow intact ALXN1840 tablets.

procedures.name: Adverse Event Monitoring
procedures.label: AE Monitoring
procedures.description: Collection and follow-up of adverse events (AEs) and serious adverse events (SAEs).

procedures.name: Urine and Bowel Movement Monitoring
procedures.label: Output Monitoring
procedures.description: Monitoring of urination and bowel movements, including menstruation checks for women.

procedures.name: Food and Fluid Sample Collection
procedures.label: Dietary Sample Collection
procedures.description: Collection of samples from all meal and fluid batches for measurement of copper and molybdenum content.

procedures.name: Urine Drug Screen
procedures.label: Urine Drug Screen
procedures.description: Screening of urine for presence of drugs.

procedures.name: Infectious Disease Screening
procedures.label: HIV, Hepatitis B/C Screen
procedures.description: Screening for Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV), Hepatitis B, and Hepatitis C.

procedures.name: Anthropometric Measurement
procedures.label: Height, Weight, BMI
procedures.description: Measurement of height, weight, and calculation of Body Mass Index (BMI).

procedures.name: Medical History Collection
procedures.label: Medical History
procedures.description: Collection of participant medical history, demographics, Wilson Disease (WD) history, and prior WD treatment.

medicalDevices.label: IV Cannula
medicalDevices.description: A cannula may be placed to minimize needle sticks for repeated blood draws.

medicalDevices.name: Catheter
medicalDevices.label: IV Catheter
medicalDevices.description: A catheter used for venous access for blood draws.

medicalDevices.name: Automated Blood Pressure and Heart Rate Device
medicalDevices.label: Automated BP Monitor
medicalDevices.description: A completely automated device to assess blood pressure and heart rate measurements.

medicalDevices.name: 12-lead ECG Machine
medicalDevices.label: ECG Machine
medicalDevices.description: Device used to perform triplicate 12-lead electrocardiograms.

medicalDevices.name: Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometer
medicalDevices.label: ICP-MS
medicalDevices.description: Laboratory equipment used to determine the copper and molybdenum concentration of food, fluid, urine, and fecal samples.

timings.name: Chelator Discontinuation Prior to First Dose

conditions.name: Safety Review for Dose Titration
conditions.description: The Safety Review Committee (SRC) must review available safety data before a participant can be titrated from 15 mg/day to 30 mg/day.
conditions.text: Before titration to 30 mg/day, the Safety Review Committee (SRC) will review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant.

conditions.name: Moderate Transaminase Elevation
conditions.description: Criteria for temporary dose interruption due to moderate liver enzyme elevation.

conditions.name: Severe Transaminase Elevation
conditions.description: Criteria for permanent discontinuation due to severe liver enzyme elevation.

conditions.name: Significant Hemoglobin Decrease
conditions.description: Criteria for dose reduction due to a significant decrease in hemoglobin from baseline.

conditions.name: Significant Platelet Decrease
conditions.description: Criteria for dose reduction due to a significant decrease in platelets from baseline.

conditions.name: Significant Neutrophil Decrease
conditions.description: Criteria for dose reduction due to a significant decrease in neutrophils from baseline.

conditions.name: Potential Hy's Law
conditions.description: Criteria for temporary dose interruption due to concurrent elevation of bilirubin and ALT.
conditions.text: Bilirubin > 2 × ULN Accompanied by ALT > 3 × ULN

conditions.name: Neurologic Worsening
conditions.description: Criteria for potential dose modification based on clinical neurologic assessment.
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment

conditions.name: Psychiatric Worsening
conditions.description: Criteria for potential dose modification based on clinical psychiatric assessment.
conditions.text: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening which may include but not limited to suicidality, acute depression, or psychosis.

conditions.name: Outpatient Period Extension
conditions.description: The outpatient period can be extended with Investigator approval.
conditions.text: To ensure flexibility, the Outpatient Period during Treatment Period 1 may be extended up to an additional 14 days with Investigator approval.

transitionRules.name: Dose Titration to 30 mg/day
transitionRules.text: Following the Run-in Period, participants will be administered ALXN1840 at 15 mg/day for a treatment period of approximately 28 days followed by titration up to 30 mg/day on Day 29.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Moderate Transaminase Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT is > 3x to <= 5x ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing. Rechallenge at 15 mg QOD when ALT is < 2x ULN.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Hematologic Abnormality
transitionRules.text: If Hemoglobin > 20% decrease, or Platelets/Neutrophils > 30% decrease from baseline, reduce dose to previous dose level or to 15 mg QOD.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Liver Injury
transitionRules.text: If Bilirubin > 2x ULN with ALT > 3x ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing. Rechallenge at 15 mg QOD or less when bilirubin is below ULN, with Medical Monitor approval.

transitionRules.name: Dose Modification for Neurologic or Psychiatric Worsening
transitionRules.text: Investigator and Alexion Medical Monitor will evaluate the need for dose modification (interruption, increase or decrease) based on neurologic or psychiatric worsening.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Severe Transaminase Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT > 5x ULN, discontinue study intervention.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Serious Hypersensitivity
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if a serious hypersensitivity reaction occurs.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Severe Infection
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for a severe uncontrolled infection.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Pregnancy
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for pregnancy or planned pregnancy.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant is considered to have completed the study if he/she has completed all phases of the study including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities (SoA).

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Participant Withdrawal of Consent
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator Discretion Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may be withdrawn at any time at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant will be considered lost to follow-up if he or she repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site.

analysisPopulations.description: A subset of the FA Set who are compliant with the protocol and do not have any major protocol deviations that would impact the interpretability of the efficacy data. The PP Set will be used for sensitivity analyses of the primary efficacy endpoint.

analysisPopulations.name: Safety Set
analysisPopulations.description: All participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug. This set will be used for all safety analyses.
analysisPopulations.criteria: Received at least 1 dose of study drug

analysisPopulations.name: Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set
analysisPopulations.label: PK
analysisPopulations.description: All participants in the Safety Set who have sufficient plasma concentration data to derive at least 1 PK parameter. This set will be used for all PK analyses.
analysisPopulations.criteria: In Safety Set and has sufficient plasma concentration data to derive at least 1 PK parameter

analysisPopulations.name: Pharmacodynamic Analysis Set
analysisPopulations.label: PD
analysisPopulations.description: All participants in the Safety Set who have sufficient PD data to derive at least 1 PD parameter. This set will be used for all PD analyses.
analysisPopulations.criteria: In Safety Set and has sufficient PD data to derive at least 1 PD parameter

studyDefinitionDocumentVersions.description: Clarify study procedures in the US to facilitate recruitment and lessen inconvenience for participants.

studyAmendmentImpacts.description: A footnote was added to the Schedule of Activities table to reference new procedures for US-only screening sites.

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 4.2 - Scientific Rationale for Study Design
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: The scientific rationale was updated for consistency with other parts of the protocol regarding zinc discontinuation.
New procedures were added to allow for US-based sites that only perform screening activities, impacting site operations and participant recruitment.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: To clarify study procedures occurring across different sites in the US, so as to facilitate participant recruitment across different regions of the US, and to lessen inconvenience for participants without compromising the quality of the study.
To align the number of days with the mention of zinc discontinuation elsewhere in the protocol.

studyChanges.afterText: Addition of text to the footnote to state that procedures specific to screening sites (only in the US) detailed in Section 8
studyChanges.summary: A footnote was added to the Schedule of Activities table to cross-reference the new US-specific screening site procedures in Section 8.

studyChanges.beforeText: ...the inhibitory effect of zinc on intestinal copper absorption is expected to be minimal 30 days after discontinuation of zinc.
studyChanges.afterText: ...the inhibitory effect of zinc on intestinal copper absorption is expected to be minimal 21 days after discontinuation of zinc.
studyChanges.summary: The number of days for the inhibitory effect of zinc to become minimal was changed from 30 to 21 for consistency.

studyChanges.afterText: Addition of text applicable only to the US that details the possibility for sites in the US to only perform screening procedures and not any of the remaining study procedures.
studyChanges.summary: Text was added to allow US sites to function solely as screening sites.
